title: Hell Let Loose: Vietnam Gameplay Trailer Shows Just How Explosive 50v50 Jungle Warfare Can Be
description: Developer Expression Games has released the first gameplay trailer for Hell Let Loose: Vietnam, a hardcore 50v50 first-person shooter set during the Vietnam War. A follow-up to 2021's Hell Let Loose--which was inspired by the conflicts of World War 2--players will have to once again rely on tactical teamwork to survive. Hell Let Loose: Vietnam will feature six new maps on launch day, each described by Expression Games as a mix of dense jungle, twisting deltas, and deadly open areas. You won't just be fighting on the ground either, as military helicopters serve multiple roles. From troop deployment to fire support, reconnaissance, and tactical drops, they're an invaluable tool in any match. Players can also engage each other in naval combat, as heavily armed vessels such as the iconic US patrol boat and the PBR will be featured in the game. Maps are also riddled with tunnel networks constructed by the North Vietnamese army, and these offer strategic advantages for surprise attacks and troop movements. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: John Romero's Canceled Shooter Is Back On Again, Sort Of
description: Earlier this year, John Romero--the creator of Doom and Quake--announced that his next first-person shooter had been canceled. Although Romero and his company, Romero Games, didn't confirm that the project was a victim of Microsoft's layoffs and cutbacks, one of Romero Games' laid-off employees did. However, it appears the still-unnamed shooter isn't completely dead, according to Romero himself. During his appearance at Salón del Videojuego de Madrid (via Eurogamer), Romero confirmed that the project is back on, and that it's been given a fresh redesign. "We're not starting at ground zero," said Romero. "We can take pieces out of and put into a brand-new indie game. We have a lot of stuff we can put in the game. The design is completely different, but the team is very excited about the new design." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Viture Reveals High-Tech Cyberpunk 2077 Limited-Edition XR Glasses
description: Cyberpunk 2077 fans can now own a piece of tech that feels and looks like something you'd find at Kiroshi Opticals in Night City. To celebrate the game's fifth anniversary, CD Projekt Red partnered with Viture on limited-edition XR glasses themed around Cyberpunk 2077. The Viture x Cyberpunk 2077 5th Anniversary Collector's Edition XR Glasses are numbered to 10,000 and available to purchase now for $549 on Viture's online storefront and at select major retailers. See at Viture Viture Luma Cyber XR Glasses combine the form factor of the Luma Pro ($499) with the technical enhancements found in the Luma Ultra ($599). Officially licensed collectible editions of tech and gaming products usually cost more than standard models, so it's pretty cool that the Luma Cyber XR Glasses cost $50 less than the Luma Ultra. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Disney Dreamlight Valley - All Winter Warmth Star Path Duties And How To Complete Them
description: After its recent paid expansion, Wishblossom Ranch, Disney Dreamlight Valley is back with another free update for all players to enjoy. This time around, you can finally invite beloved Disney princess Cinderella to your valley and go through her questline to form a new friendship. However, as expected, there's also a fresh Star Path for you to tackle. The Winter Warmth Star Path includes plenty of winter-themed cosmetics, furniture, and more, giving you plenty of fun stuff to decorate your valley with this holiday season. If you're struggling to figure out how to complete any of the Star Path duties, we've got all of them listed below alongside how to solve them. All Winter Warmth Star Path duties and how to complete them Buy seeds somewhere frosty - Buy seeds in the Frosted Heights Buy vegetable seeds fit for a ball - Buy Pumpkin seeds Cast around for seafood - Catch any seafood Catch fish in gold ripples - Catch any legendary fish Catch fish somewhere dazzling - Catch fish in Dazzling Beach Catch fish somewhere peaceful - Catch fish in the Peaceful Meadow Collect some shoreline shellfish - Pick up Mussels, Clams, or Oysters Complete Boutique Challenges - Complete any of Daisy's challenges Cook a fairly fancy appetizer - Cook any 4-star appetizer Cook a fairly fancy dessert - Cook any 4-star dessert Cook a fairly fancy dinner - Cook any 4-star entrees Cook a perfect appetizer - Cook any 5-star appetizer Cook a perfect dessert - Cook any 5-star dessert Cook any 2-star meal - Cook any 2-star entree Craft Bricks - Craft Bricks Craft a potion to boost your garden - Craft Miracle Growth Elixir or Even More Miraculous Growth Elixir Craft a potion to help you go fish - Craft Miraculous Fishing Bait or Even More Miraculous Fishing Bait Craft a potion to polish your Royal Pickaxe - Craft Miraculous Pickaxe Varnish or Even More Miraculous Pickaxe Varnish Craft a potion you can really "dig" - Craft Miraculous Shovel Varnish or Even More Miraculous Shovel Varnish Craft any Training Manual - Craft any of the Training Manuals Craft any refinement item - Craft any refinement item Craft anything - Craft any items Craft some Gold Ingots - Craft Gold Ingots Dig anywhere in the Valley - Dig in any biome Dig for special crystals underground - Mine for Vitalys Crystals in the Vitalys Mines Earn 30,000 Star Coins - Collect 30,000 Star Coins Earn 5,000 Dreamlight - Collect 5,000 Dreamlight Earn 7,500 Dreamlight - Collect 7,500 Dreamlight Equip a level 2 critter companion - Equip any level 2 companion Feed the Raccoon critters their favourite food - Give blueberries to Raccoons Find Memories - Collect Memory Orbs Fish somewhere forgotten - Catch fish in the Forgotten Lands Fish somewhere frosty - Catch fish in Frosted Heights Fish somewhere that's always sunlit - Catch fish in Sunlit Plateau Fish somewhere trustworthy - Catch fish in the Glade of Trust Fish somewhere valorous - Catch fish in the Forest of Valor Gain 15,000 Star Coins - Collect 15,000 Star Coins Get crafty! - Craft any items Give Cinderella her favourite gift - Give a favorite gift to Cinderella Give residents of Halloween Town their favorite gifts - Give favorite gifts to Jack or Sally Give the Sea Turtle their favourite food - Give Seaweed to Sea Turtles Give the monsters their favorite gifts - Give favorite gifts to Mike or Sully Go fish! - Catch any fish Hang out with Cinderella - Spend time hanging out with Cinderella Hang out with Donald - Spend time hanging out with Donald Hang out with Goofy - Spend time hanging out with Goofy Hang out with Merlin - Spend time hanging out with Merlin Hang out with Mickey - Spend time hanging out with Mickey Hang out with Minnie - Spend time hanging out with Minnie Harvest Olaf's nose - Harvest Carrots Harvest a key chocolate Ingredient - Harvest Cocoa Beans Harvest different fruits - Harvest any fruits Harvest some red bush berries - Harvest Raspberries Harvest vegetables that might take you to the ball - Harvest Pumpkins Have a daily discussion with Cinderella - Have a daily discussion with Cinderella Have a daily discussion with any villager - Have a daily discussion with any villager Mine for blue gems - Mine for Aquamarine, Sapphire, Blue Zircon, Pure Ice, or Star Sapphire Mine for green gems - Mine for Emerald, Peridot, or Jade Mine for green or orange gems - Mine for Emeralds, Peridots, Jade, or Citrine Mine for oval gems - Mine for Aquamarine, Citrine, Garnet, Peridot, Tourmaline, or Blue Zircon Mine for purple gems - Mine for Amethyst or Alexandrite Mine for purple or yellow gems - Amethyst, Alexandrite, Citrine, or Topaz Mine for red gems - Mine for Garnet, Ruby, or Spinel Mine for something shiny - Mine for any shiny gems Mine for square gems - Mine for Amethyst, Emerald, Ruby, Sapphire, Spinel, or Topaz Mine for white gems - Mine for Diamond or Opal Mine for yellow gems - Mine for Citrine or Topaz Mine precious gems with a Royal Tool - Mine for any gems Open up fresh Memories - Collect Memory Orbs Pet your animal companion - Sell Pumpkins Serve customers at Tiana's Palace - Serve meals at Tiana's Palace Serve customers in Chez Remy - Serve meals at Chez Remy Spend time with a villager - Spend time hanging out with any villager Tackle Royal Tasks - Complete Dreamlight Duties Take a picture of Scrooge's Shop - Take a photo of Scrooge's Shop in any biome Take a picture with Cinderella - Take a photo with Cinderella Talk to a mermaid, sea witch, or sailing prince - title: GameStop's Struggles Continue
description: GameStop has released its latest earnings report, shining a light on how the video game retailer is performing in the market--and it was a mixed quarter for the company. Revenue came in at $821 million, compared to $860.3 million during the same period last year, and short of Wall Street projections. Profit, however, soared from $17.4 million last year to $77.1 million for the latest period. GameStop's stock price sank after the earnings report came out, with many saying the revenue miss was to blame for the falling price. Others, however, have said GameStop's strong profit-growth, along with having more than $8.8 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities (up from $4.6 billion last year) is a sign of health. Additionally, GameStop's Selling, General, and Administrative (SG&A) costs were $221.4 million for the quarter, down from $282 million during the same period last year. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: This Popular Game Pass Game Gets A Movie And TV Deal
description: The next video game set for a film/TV adaptation has been announced, and it is developer RubberBandGames' sandbox game Wobbly Life. The London-based developer has announced a deal with veteran Hollywood producer Adrian Askarieh and his Prime Universe Films company to develop Wobbly Life for film and TV. This does not mean that Wobbly Life will definitely become a film or a TV series, only that the company has secured the rights and may begin the development process. Prime Universe previously produced the Hitman movies starring Timothy Olyphant and Rupert Friend. Askarieh is also attached to the in-development Hitman TV show in the works now. title: Roblox System Requirements
description: Roblox is one of the biggest games in the world, with millions of different experiences that players can hop into. One of the biggest selling points is that it can be played practically anywhere, from phones to Xbox to a standard computer. Of course, not everyone has a PC rig the size of a monster truck, and some folks just want to know if their old laptop or similar device can run Roblox, or find out why they’re running into issues. So, to help you out, we’re listing the exact Roblox system requirements below. Table of Contents [hide]Roblox Supported Platforms Roblox Supported Platforms You can fire up Roblox on almost any platform, but just in case you’re having trouble loading it up, here are the basic requirements across different platforms: Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Baldur's Gate 3 Fan Discovers Astarion Has Almost As Much Spoken Dialogue As The Narrator
description: Baldur's Gate 3 has been out for over two years now, but fans' enthusiasm for the sprawling RPG remains strong--as is the case with one fan who has spent untold hours documenting and quantifying all the spoken dialogue in the game. Redditor Everwhite-moonlight has taken the time to catalogue the game's extensive spoken dialogue fans, calling the labor-intensive task a celebration of Larian's work. The finished spreadsheet arranges the characters in order from most to least speaking time, which reveals just how much our vampire friend Astarion loves to talk. It's unsurprising that Amelia Tyler's Narrator, whose voice is ever-present through Baldur's Gate 3 as the game's pseudo-DM, has the most lines of dialogue, clocking in at a total of 14 hours and 43 minutes of speaking time. What is surprising is how (relatively) close behind her Astarion sits, with a whopping 13 hours and 6 minutes of dialogue for the Neil Newbon-voiced vampire companion. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Mystery Of The Game Awards Monolith Appears To Have Been Spoiled By A Trademark Filing
description: It's been a busy week for industry speculation after Geoff Keighley started posting about a mysterious, glowing monolith in the middle of the California desert, which was later moved into Los Angeles. Now, it appears the monolith's mystery might have just been solved through a trademark filing. Rumors that the monolith was erected to tease new Diablo 4 content, Elder Scrolls 6, God of War, or Lords of the Fallen 2 were all shot down by people in the know. While others speculated that it still could be related to The Elder Scrolls Online, or a new FromSoft game, it appears most likely that the statue is promoting a new Divinity title from Larian. A trio of trademark filings were spotted up by MP1st, including a new Divinity logo and a symbol that looks suspiciously like the glowing one on Geoff Keighley's monolith. The familiar-looking trademarks come after Larian's publishing director said there aren't currently any plans for a Divinity: Original Sin 3, meaning the upcoming title may be a new Divinity game outside of the Original Sin prequel series. Continue Reading at GameSpot
